Text: I'll do it by more drilling, more permits and licenses.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: How in the world the president said no to that pipeline?
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: This is about bringing good jobs back for the middle class of America, and that's what I'm going to do.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: Candy, there's no doubt that world demand's gone up, but our production is going up, and we're using oil more efficiently.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: And very little of what Governor Romney just said is true.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: We've opened up public lands.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: We're actually drilling more on public lands than in the previous administration and my -- the previous president was an oil man.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: And natural gas isn't just appearing magically.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: We're encouraging it and working with the industry.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: And when I hear Governor Romney say he's a big coal guy, I mean, keep in mind, when -- Governor, when you were governor of Massachusetts, you stood in front of a coal plant and pointed at it and said, "This plant kills," and took great pride in shutting it down.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: And now suddenly you're a big champion of coal.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: So what I've tried to do is be consistent.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: With respect to something like coal, we made the largest investment in clean coal technology, to make sure that even as we're producing more coal, we're producing it cleaner and smarter.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: Same thing with oil, same thing with natural gas.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: And the proof is our oil imports are down to the lowest levels in 20 years.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: Oil production is up, natural gas production is up, and, most importantly, we're also starting to build cars that are more efficient.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: That means those cars can be exported, 'cause that's the demand around the world, and it also means that it'll save money in your pocketbook.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: That's the strategy you need, an all-of-the-above strategy, and that's what we're going to do in the next four years.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: But that's not what you've done in the last four years.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: In the last four years, you cut permits and licenses on federal land and federal waters in half.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: So how much did you cut (inaudible)?
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: How much did you cut them by, then?
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: Governor, we have actually produced more oil --
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: How much did you cut licenses and permits on federal land and federal waters?
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: Governor Romney, here's what we did.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: There were a whole bunch of oil companies.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: No, no, I had a question and the question was how much did you cut them by?
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: You want me to answer a question --
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: You had a whole bunch of oil companies who had leases on public lands that they weren't using.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: So what we said was you can't just sit on this for 10, 20, 30 years, decide when you want to drill, when you want to produce, when it's most profitable for you.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: So if you want to drill on public lands, you use it or you lose it.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: And so what we did was take away those leases.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: And we are now reletting them so that we can actually make a profit.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: And production on private -- on government land --
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: Look, there's no question but the people recognize that we have not produced more (inaudible) on federal lands and in federal waters.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: I was just at a coal facility, where some 1,200 people lost their jobs.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: The right course for America is to have a true all-of-the-above policy.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: I don't think anyone really believes that you're a person who's going to be pushing for oil and gas and coal.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: You'll get your chance in a moment.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: And the answer is I don't believe people think that's the case --
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: I will fight for oil, coal and natural gas.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: And the proof, the proof of whether a strategy is working or not is what the price is that you're paying at the pump.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: If you're paying less than you paid a year or two ago, why, then, the strategy is working.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: When the president took office, the price of gasoline here in Nassau County was about $1.86 a gallon.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: Now, it's $4.00 a gallon.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: The price of electricity is up.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: If the president's energy policies are working, you're going to see the cost of energy come down.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: I will fight to create more energy in this country, to get America energy secure.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: And part of that is bringing in a pipeline of oil from Canada, taking advantage of the oil and coal we have here, drilling offshore in Alaska, drilling offshore in Virginia where the people want it.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: Those things will get us the energy we need.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: Well, think about what the governor -- think about what the governor just said.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: He said when I took office, the price of gasoline was $1.80, $1.86.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: Because the economy was on the verge of collapse, because we were about to go through the worst recession since the Great Depression, as a consequence of some of the same policies that Governor Romney's now promoting.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: So, it's conceivable that Governor Romney could bring down gas prices because with his policies, we might be back in that same mess.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: What I want to do is to create an economy that is strong, and at the same time produce energy.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: And with respect to this pipeline that Governor Romney keeps on talking about, we've -- we've built enough pipeline to wrap around the entire earth once.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: So, I'm all for pipelines.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: I'm all for oil production.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: What I'm not for is us ignoring the other half of the equation.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: So, for example, on wind energy, when Governor Romney says "these are imaginary jobs."
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: When you've got thousands of people right now in Iowa, right now in Colorado, who are working, creating wind power with good-paying manufacturing jobs, and the Republican senator in that -- in Iowa is all for it, providing tax breaks (ph) to help this work and Governor Romney says I'm opposed.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: I'd get rid of it.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: That's not an energy strategy for the future.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: He gets the first --
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: He actually got the first question.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: So I get the last question -- last answer --
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: Candy, I don't have a policy of stopping wind jobs in Iowa and that -- they're not phantom jobs.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: I appreciate wind jobs in Iowa and across our country.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: I appreciate the jobs in coal and oil and gas.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: I'm going to make sure --
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: -- we're taking advantage of our energy resources.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: We'll bring back manufacturing to America.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: We're going to get through a very aggressive energy policy, 31/2 million more jobs in this country.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: It's critical to our future.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: Candy, it's not going to --
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: And let me tell you, you're absolutely right about part of that, which is I want to bring the rates down, I want to simplify the tax code, and I want to get middle- income taxpayers to have lower taxes.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: And the reason I want middle-income taxpayers to have lower taxes is because middle-income taxpayers have been buried over the past four years.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: You've seen, as middle-income people in this country, incomes go down $4,300 a family, even as gasoline prices have gone up $2,000.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: Health insurance premiums, up $2,500.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: The middle-income families in America have been crushed over the last four years.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: So I want to get some relief to middle-income families.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: That's part -- that's part one.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: 'Cause I'm going to bring rates down across the board for everybody, but I'm going to limit deductions and exemptions and credits, particularly for people at the high end, because I am not going to have people at the high end pay less than they're paying now.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: The top 5 percent of taxpayers will continue to pay 60 percent of the income tax the nation collects.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: So that'll stay the same.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: Middle-income people are going to get a tax break.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: And so, in terms of bringing down deductions, one way of doing that would be say everybody gets -- I'll pick a number -- $25,000 of deductions and credits, and you can decide which ones to use.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: Your home mortgage interest deduction, charity, child tax credit, and so forth, you can use those as part of filling that bucket, if you will, of deductions.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: But your rate comes down and the burden also comes down on you for one more reason, and that is every middle-income taxpayer no longer will pay any tax on interest, dividends or capital gains.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: No tax on your savings.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: That makes life a lot easier.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: If you're getting interest from a bank, if you're getting a statement from a mutual fund or any other kind of investment you have, you don't have to worry about filing taxes on that, because there'll be no taxes for anybody making $200,000.00 per year and less, on your interest, dividends and capital gains.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: Because under the last four years, they've been buried.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: And I want to help people in the middle-class.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: And I will not -- I will not under any circumstances, reduce the share that's being paid by the highest income taxpayers.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: The president's spending, the president's borrowing will cost this nation to have to raise taxes on the American people.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: Not just at the high end.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: I will not let that happen.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: I want to get us on track to a balanced budget, and I'm going to reduce the tax burden on middle income families.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: And what's that going to do?
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: It's going to help those families, and it's going to create incentives to start growing jobs again in this country.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: My philosophy on taxes has been simple.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: And that is, I want to give middle-class families and folks who are striving to get into the middle-class some relief.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: Because they have been hit hard over the last decade.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: Over the last 15, over the last 20 years.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: So four years ago I stood on a stage just like this one.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: I said I would cut taxes for small businesses, who are the drivers and engines of growth.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: And we've cut them 18 times.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: And I want to continue those tax cuts for middle-class families, and for small business.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: But what I've also said is, if we're serious about reducing the deficit, if this is genuinely a moral obligation to the next generation, then in addition to some tough spending cuts, we've also got to make sure that the wealthy do a little bit more.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: So what I've said is, your first $250,000.00 worth of income, no change.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: And that means 98 percent of American families, 97 percent of small businesses, they will not see a tax increase.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: I'm ready to sign that bill right now.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: The only reason it's not happening is because Governor Romney's allies in Congress have held the 98 percent hostage because they want tax breaks for the top 2 percent.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: But what I've also says is for above $250,000, we can go back to the tax rates we had when Bill Clinton was president.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: We created 23 million new jobs.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: That's part of what took us from deficits to surplus.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: Now, Governor Romney has a different philosophy.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: He was on 60 Minutes just two weeks ago and he was asked: Is it fair for somebody like you, making $20 million a year, to pay a lower tax rate than a nurse or a bus driver, somebody making $50,000 year?
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: And he said, "Yes, I think that's fair."
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: Not only that, he said, "I think that's what grows the economy."
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: Well, I fundamentally disagree with that.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: I think what grows the economy is when you get that tax credit that we put in place for your kids going to college.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: So we just have a different theory.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: And when Governor Romney stands here, after a year of campaigning, when during a Republican primary he stood on stage and said "I'm going to give tax cuts" -- he didn't say tax rate cuts, he said "tax cuts to everybody," including the top 1 percent, you should believe him because that's been his history.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: And that's exactly the kind of top-down economics that is not going to work if we want a strong middle class and an economy that's striving for everybody.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: You heard what I said about my tax plan.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: I'm not looking to cut taxes for wealthy people.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: I am looking to cut taxes for middle-income people.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: And why do I want to bring rates down, and at the same time lower exemptions and deductions, particularly for people at the high end?
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: Because if you bring rates down, it makes it easier for small business to keep more of their capital and hire people.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: And for me, this is about jobs.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: I want to get America's economy going again.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: Fifty-four percent of America's workers work in businesses that are taxed as individuals.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: So when you bring those rates down, those small businesses are able to keep more money and hire more people.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: For me, I look at what's happened in the last four years and say this has been a disappointment.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: We can do better than this.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: We don't have to settle for, how many months, 43 months with unemployment above 8 percent, 23 million Americans struggling to find a good job right now.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: There are 3.5 million more women living in poverty today than when the president took office.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: We can get this economy going again.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: My five-point plan does it.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: Energy independence for North America in five years.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: Opening up more trade, particularly in Latin America.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: Cracking down on China when they cheat.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: Getting us to a balanced budget.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: Fixing our training programs for our workers.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: And finally, championing small business.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: I want to make small businesses grow and thrive.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: I know how to make that happen.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: I spent my life in the private sector.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: I know why jobs come and why they go.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: And they're going now because of the policies of this administration.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: Look, the cost of lowering rates for everybody across the board, 20 percent.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: Governor Romney then also wants to spend $2 trillion on additional military programs even though the military's not asking for them.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: He also wants to continue the Bush tax cuts for the wealthiest Americans.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: That's another trillion dollars -- that's $8 trillion.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: Now, what he says is he's going to make sure that this doesn't add to the deficit and he's going to cut middleclass taxes.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: But when he's asked, how are you going to do it, which deductions, which loopholes are you going to close?
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: The -- the fact that he only has to pay 14 percent on his taxes when a lot of you are paying much higher.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: He's already taken that off the board, capital gains are going to continue to be at a low rate so we -- we're not going to get money that way.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: We haven't heard from the governor any specifics beyond Big Bird and eliminating funding for Planned Parenthood in terms of how he pays for that.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: Now, Governor Romney was a very successful investor.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: If somebody came to you, Governor, with a plan that said, here, I want to spend $7 or $8 trillion, and then we're going to pay for it, but we can't tell you until maybe after the election how we're going to do it, you wouldn't take such a sketchy deal and neither should you, the American people, because the math doesn't add up.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: And -- and what's at stake here is one of two things, either Candy -- this blows up the deficit because keep in mind, this is just to pay for the additional spending that he's talking about, $7 trillion - $8 trillion before we even get to the deficit we already have.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: Or, alternatively, it's got to be paid for, not only by closing deductions for wealthy individuals, that -- that will pay for about 4 percent reduction in tax rates.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: You're going to be paying for it.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: You're going to lose some deductions, and you can't buy the sales pitch.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: Nobody who's looked at it that's serious, actually believes it adds up.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: Well of course they add up.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: I -- I was -- I was someone who ran businesses for 25 years, and balanced the budget.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: I ran the Olympics and balanced the budget.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: I ran the -- the state of Massachusetts as a governor, to the extent any governor does, and balanced the budget all four years.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: When we're talking about math that doesn't add up, how about $4 trillion of deficits over the last four years, $5 trillion?
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: That's math that doesn't add up.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: We have -- we have a president talking about someone's plan in a way that's completely foreign to what my real plan is.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: And then we have his own record, which is we have four consecutive years where he said when he was running for office, he would cut the deficit in half.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: We've gone from $10 trillion of national debt, to $16 trillion of national debt.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: If the president were reelected, we'd go to almost $20 trillion of national debt.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: This puts us on a road to Greece.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: I know what it takes to balance budgets.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: I've done it my entire life.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: So for instance when he says, "Yours is a $5 trillion cut."
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: Because I'm offsetting some of the reductions with holding down some of the deductions.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: And I just described -- I just described to you, Mr. President -- I just described to you precisely how I'd do it which is with a single number that people can put -- and they can put they're -- they're deductions and credits...
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: And it's Katherine Fenton, who has a question for you.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: And she worked hard every day and made a lot of sacrifices to make sure we got everything we needed.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: My grandmother, she started off as a secretary in a bank.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: She never got a college education, even though she was smart as a whip.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: And she worked her way up to become a vice president of a local bank, but she hit the glass ceiling.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: She trained people who would end up becoming her bosses during the course of her career.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: That's not what you did in that generation.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: And this is one of the reasons why one of the first -- the first bill I signed was something called the Lily Ledbetter bill.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: And it's named after this amazing woman who had been doing the same job as a man for years, found out that she was getting paid less, and the Supreme Court said that she couldn't bring suit because she should have found about it earlier, whereas she had no way of finding out about it.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: And that's an example of the kind of advocacy that we need, because women are increasingly the breadwinners in the family.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: This is not just a women's issue, this is a family issue, this is a middle-class issue, and that's why we've got to fight for it.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: It also means that we've got to make sure that young people like yourself are able to afford a college education.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: Earlier, Governor Romney talked about he wants to make Pell Grants and other education accessible for young people.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: Well, the truth of the matter is, is that that's exactly what we've done.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: We've expanded Pell Grants for millions of people, including millions of young women, all across the country.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: We did it by taking $60 billion that was going to banks and lenders as middlemen for the student loan program, and we said, let's just cut out the middleman.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: Let's give the money directly to students.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: And as a consequence, we've seen millions of young people be able to afford college, and that's going to make sure that young women are going to be able to compete in that marketplace.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: But we've got to enforce the laws, which is what we are doing, and we've also got to make sure that in every walk of life we do not tolerate discrimination.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: That's been one of the hallmarks of my administration.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: I'm going to continue to push on this issue for the next four years.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: And important topic, and one which I learned a great deal about, particularly as I was serving as governor of my state, because I had the chance to pull together a cabinet and all the applicants seemed to be men.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: And I -- and I went to my staff, and I said, "How come all the people for these jobs are -- are all men."
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: They said, "Well, these are the people that have the qualifications."
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: And I said, "Well, gosh, can't we -- can't we find some -- some women that are also qualified?"
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: And -- and so we -- we took a concerted effort to go out and find women who had backgrounds that could be qualified to become members of our cabinet.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: I went to a number of women's groups and said, "Can you help us find folks," and they brought us whole binders full of women.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: Now one of the reasons I was able to get so many good women to be part of that team was because of our recruiting effort.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: But number two, because I recognized that if you're going to have women in the workforce that sometimes you need to be more flexible.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: My chief of staff, for instance, had two kids that were still in school.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: I need to be able to get home at 5 o'clock so I can be there for making dinner for my kids and being with them when they get home from school.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: We're going to have to have employers in the new economy, in the economy I'm going to bring to play, that are going to be so anxious to get good workers they're going to be anxious to hire women.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: That's the net of what's happened in the last four years.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: We're still down 580,000 jobs.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: What we can do to help young women and women of all ages is to have a strong economy, so strong that employers that are looking to find good employees and bringing them into their workforce and adapting to a flexible work schedule that gives women opportunities that they would otherwise not be able to afford.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: This is what I have done.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: It's what I look forward to doing and I know what it takes to make an economy work, and I know what a working economy looks like.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: And an economy with 7.8 percent unemployment is not a real strong economy.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: An economy with 50 percent of kids graduating from college that can't finds a job, or a college level job, that's not what we have to have.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: I'm going to help women in America get good work by getting a stronger economy and by supporting women in the workforce.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: Katherine, I just want to point out that when Governor Romney's campaign was asked about the Lilly Ledbetter bill, whether he supported it?
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: He said, "I'll get back to you."
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: And that's not the kind of advocacy that women need in any economy.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: Now, there are some other issues that have a bearing on how women succeed in the workplace.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: You know a major difference in this campaign is that Governor Romney feels comfortable having politicians in Washington decide the health care choices that women are making.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: I think that's a mistake.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: In my health care bill, I said insurance companies need to provide contraceptive coverage to everybody who is insured.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: Because this is not just a -- a health issue, it's an economic issue for women.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: This is money out of that family's pocket.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: That's not the kind of advocacy that women need.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: When Governor Romney says that we should eliminate funding for Planned Parenthood, there are millions of women all across the country, who rely on Planned Parenthood for, not just contraceptive care, they rely on it for mammograms, for cervical cancer screenings.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: That's a pocketbook issue for women and families all across the country.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: And it makes a difference in terms of how well and effectively women are able to work.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: When we talk about child care, and the credits that we're providing.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: That makes a difference in whether they can go out there and -- and earn a living for their family.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: These are not just women's issues.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: And one of the things that makes us grow as an economy is when everybody participates and women are getting the same fair deal as men are.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: That's part of what I'm fighting for as president of the United States.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: I just want to make sure that, I think I was supposed to get that last answer, but I want to point out that that I don't believe...
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: I don't think so, Candy.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: I want to make sure our timekeepers are working here.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: I'd just note that I don't believe that bureaucrats in Washington should tell someone whether they can use contraceptives or not.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: And I don't believe employers should tell someone whether they could have contraceptive care of not.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: Every woman in America should have access to contraceptives.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: And -- and the -- and the president's statement of my policy is completely and totally wrong.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: I mean for instance, we can now, by virtue of new technology actually get all the energy we need in North America without having to go to the -- the Arabs or the Venezuelans or anyone else.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: That wasn't true in his time, that's why my policy starts with a very robust policy to get all that energy in North America -- become energy secure.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: Number two, trade -- I'll crack down on China, President Bush didn't.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: I'm also going to dramatically expand trade in Latin America.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: It's been growing about 12 percent per year over a long period of time.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: I want to add more free trade agreements so we'll have more trade.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: Number three, I'm going to get us to a balanced budget.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: President Obama was right, he said that that was outrageous to have deficits as high as half a trillion dollars under the Bush years.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: And his forecast for the next four years is more deficits, almost that large.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: So that's the next area I'm different than President Bush.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: And then let's take the last one, championing small business.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: Our party has been focused too long.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: I came through small business.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: I understand how hard it is to start a small business.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: That's why everything I'll do is designed to help small businesses grow and add jobs.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: I want to keep their taxes down on small business.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: I want regulators to see their job as encouraging small enterprise, not crushing it.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: And the thing I find the most troubling about Obama Care, well it's a long list, but one of the things I find most troubling is that when you go out and talk to small businesses and ask them what they think about it, they tell you it keeps them from hiring more people.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: And President Bush has a very different path for a very different time.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: My path is designed in getting small businesses to grow and hire people.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: Well, first of all, I think it's important to tell you that we did come in during some tough times.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: But we had been digging our way out of policies that were misplaced and focused on the top doing very well and middle class folks not doing well.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: And the plans that I talked about will create even more.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: But when Governor Romney says that he has a very different economic plan, the centerpiece of his economic plan are tax cuts.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: That's what took us from surplus to deficit.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: When he talks about getting tough on China, keep in mind that Governor Romney invested in companies that were pioneers of outsourcing to China, and is currently investing in countries -- in companies that are building surveillance equipment for China to spy on its own folks.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: That's -- Governor, you're the last person who's going to get tough on China.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: And what we've done when it comes to trade is not only sign three trade deals to open up new markets, but we've also set up a task force for trade that goes after anybody who is taking advantage of American workers or businesses and not creating a level playing field.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: When I said that we had to make sure that China was not flooding our domestic market with cheap tires, Governor Romney said I was being protectionist; that it wouldn't be helpful to American workers.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: And that's the kind of tough trade actions that are required.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: You know, there are some things where Governor Romney is different from George Bush.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: George Bush didn't propose turning Medicare into a voucher.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: George Bush embraced comprehensive immigration reform.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: He didn't call for self-deportation.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: George Bush never suggested that we eliminate funding for Planned Parenthood, so there are differences between Governor Romney and George Bush, but they're not on economic policy.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: In some ways, he's gone to a more extreme place when it comes to social policy.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: And I think that's a mistake.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: That's not how we're going to move our economy forward.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: Well, we've gone through a tough four years.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: There's no doubt about it.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: But four years ago, I told the American people and I told you I would cut taxes for middle class families.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: I told you I'd cut taxes for small businesses, and I have.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: I said that I'd end the war in Iraq, and I did.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: I said we'd refocus attention on those who actually attacked us on 9/11, and we have gone after Al Qaeda's leadership like never before and Osama bin Laden is dead.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: I said that we would put in place health care reform to make sure that insurance companies can't jerk you around and if you don't have health insurance, that you'd have a chance to get affordable insurance, and I have.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: I committed that I would rein in the excesses of Wall Street, and we passed the toughest Wall Street reforms since the 1930s.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: We've created five million jobs, and gone from 800 jobs a month being lost, and we are making progress.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: We saved an auto industry that was on the brink of collapse.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: Now, does that mean you're not struggling?
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: A lot of us are.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: And that's why the plan that I've put forward for manufacturing and education, and reducing our deficit in a sensible way, using the savings from ending wars, to rebuild America and putting people back to work.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: Making sure that we are controlling our own energy, but not only the energy of today, but also the energy of the future.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: All of those things will make a difference, so the point is the commitments I've made, I've kept.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: And those that I haven't been able to keep, it's not for lack of trying and we're going to get it done in a second term.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: But, you should pay attention to this campaign, because Governor Romney has made some commitments as well.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: And I suspect he'll keep those too.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: You know when members of the Republican Congress say, "We're going to sign a no tax pledge, so that we don't ask a dime for millionaires and billionaires to reduce our deficit so we can still invest in education, and helping kids go to college.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: When they said, "We're going to cut Planned Parenthood funding."
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: When he said, "We're going to repeal Obamacare.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: First thing I'm going to do," despite the fact that it's the same health care plan that he passed in Massachusetts and is working well.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: That is not the kind of leadership that you need, but you should expect that those are promises he's going to keep.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: ...the choice in this election is going to be whose promises are going to be more likely to help you in your life?
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: Make sure your kids can go to college.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: Make sure that you are getting a good paying job, making sure that Medicare and Social Security... (CROSSTALK)
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: ...will be there for you.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: I think you know better.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: I think you know that these last four years haven't been so good as the president just described and that you don't feel like your confident that the next four years are going to be much better either.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: I can tell you that if you were to elect President Obama, you know what you're going to get.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: You're going to get a repeat of the last four years.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: We just can't afford four more years like the last four years.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: The difference between where it is and 5.4 percent is 9 million Americans without work.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: I wasn't the one that said 5.4 percent.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: This was the president's plan.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: He said he would have by now put forward a plan to reform Medicare and Social Security, because he pointed out they're on the road to bankruptcy.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: He hasn't even made a proposal on either one.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: He said in his first year he'd put out an immigration plan that would deal with our immigration challenges.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: This is a president who has not been able to do what he said he'd do.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: He said that he'd cut in half the deficit.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: He hasn't done that either.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: In fact, he doubled it.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: He said that by now middle-income families would have a reduction in their health insurance premiums by $2,500 a year.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: It's gone up by $2,500 a year.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: And if Obamacare is passed, or implemented -- it's already been passed -- if it's implemented fully, it'll be another $2,500 on top.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: The middle class is getting crushed under the policies of a president who has not understood what it takes to get the economy working again.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: He keeps saying, "Look, I've created 5 million jobs."
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: That's after losing 5 million jobs.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: There are more people in poverty, one out of six people in poverty.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: When he took office, 32 million people were on food stamps.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: Today, 47 million people are on food stamps.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: How about the growth of the economy?
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: It's growing more slowly this year than last year, and more slowly last year than the year before.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: The president wants to do well.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: But the policies he's put in place from Obamacare to Dodd-Frank to his tax policies to his regulatory policies, these policies combined have not let this economy take off and grow like it could have.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: You might say, "Well, you got an example of one that worked better?"
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: Five million jobs doesn't even keep up with our population growth.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: And the only reason the unemployment rate seems a little lower today is because of all the people that have dropped out of the workforce.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: The president has tried, but his policies haven't worked.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: He's great as a -- as a -- as a speaker and describing his plans and his vision.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: That's wonderful, except we have a record to look at.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: That's what this election is about.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: It's about who can get the middle class in this country a bright and prosperous future and assure our kids the kind of hope and optimism they deserve.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: This is for Governor Romney?
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: Did I get that right?
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: And let me step back and tell you what I would like to do with our immigration policy broadly and include an answer to your question.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: We welcome people coming to this country as immigrants.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: My dad was born in Mexico of American parents; Ann's dad was born in Wales and is a first-generation American.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: We welcome legal immigrants into this country.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: I want our legal system to work better.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: I don't think you have to -- shouldn't have to hire a lawyer to figure out how to get into this country legally.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: I also think that we should give visas to people -- green cards, rather, to people who graduate with skills that we need.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: People around the world with accredited degrees in science and math get a green card stapled to their diploma, come to the U.S. of A.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: Number two, we're going to have to stop illegal immigration.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: Those who've come here illegally take their place.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: What I will do is I'll put in place an employment verification system and make sure that employers that hire people who have come here illegally are sanctioned for doing so.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: I won't put in place magnets for people coming here illegally.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: So for instance, I would not give driver's licenses to those that have come here illegally as the president would.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: The kids of those that came here illegally, those kids, I think, should have a pathway to become a permanent resident of the United States and military service, for instance, is one way they would have that kind of pathway to become a permanent resident.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: Now when the president ran for office, he said that he'd put in place, in his first year, a piece of legislation -- he'd file a bill in his first year that would reform our -- our immigration system, protect legal immigration, stop illegal immigration.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: He had a Democrat House, a Democrat Senate, super majority in both Houses.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: Why did he fail to even promote legislation that would have provided an answer for those that want to come legally and for those that are here illegally today?
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: What's a question I think the -- the president will have a chance to answer right now.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: Good, I look forward to it.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: Was -- Lorranna -- Lorraine -- we are a nation of immigrants.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: We all understand what this country has become because talent from all around the world wants to come here.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: People are willing to take risks.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: People who want to build on their dreams and make sure their kids have an even bigger dreams than they have.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: But we're also a nation of laws.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: So what I've said is we need to fix a broken immigration system and I've done everything that I can on my own and sought cooperation from Congress to make sure that we fix the system.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: The first thing we did was to streamline the legal immigration system, to reduce the backlog, make it easier, simpler and cheaper for people who are waiting in line, obeying the law to make sure that they can come here and contribute to our country and that's good for our economic growth.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: They'll make things happen to create jobs here in the United States.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: What I've also said is if we're going to go after folks who are here illegally, we should do it smartly and go after folks who are criminals, gang bangers, people who are hurting the community, not after students, not after folks who are here just because they're trying to figure out how to feed their families.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: And that's what we've done.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: And what I've also said is for young people who come here, brought here often times by their parents.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: Had gone to school here, pledged allegiance to the flag.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: Think of this as their country.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: Understand themselves as Americans in every way except having papers.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: And we should make sure that we give them a pathway to citizenship.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: And that's what I've done administratively.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: Now, Governor Romney just said, you know he wants to help those young people too, but during the Republican primary, he said, "I will veto the DREAM Act", that would allow these young people to have access."
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: His main strategy during the Republican primary was to say, "We're going to encourage self-deportation."
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: Making life so miserable on folks that they'll leave.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: He called the Arizona law a model for the nation.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: Part of the Arizona law said that law enforcement officers could stop folks because they suspected maybe they looked like they might be undocumented workers and check their papers.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: If my daughter or yours looks to somebody like they're not a citizen, I don't want -- I don't want to empower somebody like that.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: So, we can fix this system in a comprehensive way.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: And when Governor Romney says, the challenge is, "Well Obama didn't try."
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: I have sat down with Democrats and Republicans at the beginning of my term.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: And I said, let's fix this system.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: Including Senators previously who had supported it on the Republican side.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: But it's very hard for Republican's in Congress to support comprehensive immigration reform, if their standard bearer has said that, this is not something I'm interested in supporting.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: No, let -- let -- let me go back and speak to the points that the president made and -- and -- and let's get them correct.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: I did not say that the Arizona law was a model for the nation in that aspect.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: I said that the E-Verify portion of the Arizona law, which is -- which is the portion of the law which says that employers could be able to determine whether someone is here illegally or not illegally, that that was a model for the nation.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: Number two, I asked the president a question I think Hispanics and immigrants all over the nation have asked.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: Why, when you said you'd filed legislation in your first year didn't you do it?
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: He -- he doesn't answer that question.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: He said the standard bearer wasn't for it.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: I'm glad you thought I was a standard bearer four years ago, but I wasn't.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: Four years ago you said in your first year you would file legislation.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: In his first year, I was just getting -- licking my wounds from having been beaten by John McCain, all right.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: I was not the standard bearer.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: My -- my view is that this president should have honored his promise to do as he said.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: Now, let me mention one other thing, and that is self-deportation says let people make their own choice.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: What I was saying is, we're not going to round up 12 million people, undocumented illegals, and take them out of the nation.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: Instead let people make their own choice.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: And if they -- if they find that -- that they can't get the benefits here that they want and they can't -- and they can't find the job they want, then they'll make a decision to go a place where -- where they have better opportunities.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: But I'm not in favor of rounding up people and -- and -- and taking them out of this country.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: I am in favor, as the president has said, and I agree with him, which is that if people have committed crimes we got to get them out of this country.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: Let me mention something else the president said.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: It was a moment ago and I didn't get a chance to, when he was describing Chinese investments and so forth.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: Just going to make a point.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: Any investments I have over the last eight years have been managed by a blind trust.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: And I understand they do include investments outside the United States, including in -- in Chinese companies.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: Mr. President, have you looked at your pension?
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: Have you looked at your pension?
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: Mr. President, have you looked at your pension?
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: You know, I -- I don't look at my pension.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: It's not as big as yours so it doesn't take as long.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: Well, let me give you some advice.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: I don't check it that often.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: Let me give you some advice.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: You also have investments in Chinese companies.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: You also have investments outside the United States.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: You also have investments through a Cayman's trust.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: I thought we were talking about immigration.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: I do want to make sure that...
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: Governor Romney says he wasn't referring to Arizona as a model for the nation.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: His top adviser on immigration is the guy who designed the Arizona law, the entirety of it; not E-Verify, the whole thing.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: And it's a bad policy.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: And it won't help us grow.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: Look, when we think about immigration, we have to understand there are folks all around the world who still see America as the land of promise.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: And they provide us energy and they provide us innovation and they start companies like Intel and Google.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: Now, we've got to make sure that we do it in a smart way and a comprehensive way, and we make the legal system better.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: But when we make this into a divisive political issue, and when we don't have bipartisan support -- I can deliver, Governor, a whole bunch of Democrats to get comprehensive immigration reform done, and we can't...
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: ... we can't -- we have not seen Republicans serious about this issue at all.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: And it's time for them to get serious on it.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: This used to be a bipartisan issue.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: Well, let me first of all talk about our diplomats, because they serve all around the world and do an incredible job in a very dangerous situation.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: And these aren't just representatives of the United States, they are my representatives.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: I send them there, oftentimes into harm's way.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: I know these folks and I know their families.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: So nobody is more concerned about their safety and security than I am.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: So as soon as we found out that the Benghazi consulate was being overrun, I was on the phone with my national security team and I gave them three instructions.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: Number one, beef up our security and procedures, not just in Libya, but at every embassy and consulate in the region.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: Number two, investigate exactly what happened, regardless of where the facts lead us, to make sure folks are held accountable and it doesn't happen again.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: And number three, we are going to find out who did this and we're going to hunt them down, because one of the things that I've said throughout my presidency is when folks mess with Americans, we go after them.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: Now Governor Romney had a very different response.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: While we were still dealing with our diplomats being threatened, Governor Romney put out a press release, trying to make political points, and that's not how a commander in chief operates.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: You don't turn national security into a political issue.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: Certainly not right when it's happening.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: And people -- not everybody agrees with some of the decisions I've made.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: But when it comes to our national security, I mean what I say.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: I said I'd end the war in Libya -- in -- in Iraq, and I did.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: I said that we'd go after al-Qaeda and bin Laden, we have.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: I said we'd transition out of Afghanistan, and start making sure that Afghans are responsible for their own security, that's what I'm doing.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: And when it comes to this issue, when I say that we are going to find out exactly what happened, everybody will be held accountable.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: And I am ultimately responsible for what's taking place there because these are my folks, and I'm the one who has to greet those coffins when they come home.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: You know that I mean what I say.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: And -- and I -- I think the president just said correctly that the buck does stop at his desk and -- and he takes responsibility for -- for that -- for the failure in providing those security resources, and -- and those terrible things may well happen from time to time.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: I -- I'm -- I feel very deeply sympathetic for the families of those who lost loved ones.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: We -- we think of their families and care for them deeply.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: There were other issues associated with this -- with this tragedy.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: There were many days that passed before we knew whether this was a spontaneous demonstration, or actually whether it was a terrorist attack.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: And there was no demonstration involved.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: It was a terrorist attack and it took a long time for that to be told to the American people.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: Whether there was some misleading, or instead whether we just didn't know what happened, you have to ask yourself why didn't we know five days later when the ambassador to the United Nations went on TV to say that this was a demonstration.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: How could we have not known?
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: But I find more troubling than this, that on -- on the day following the assassination of the United States ambassador, the first time that's happened since 1979, when -- when we have four Americans killed there, when apparently we didn't know what happened, that the president, the day after that happened, flies to Las Vegas for a political fund-raiser, then the next day to Colorado for another event, other political event.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: I think these -- these actions taken by a president and a leader have symbolic significance and perhaps even material significance in that you'd hope that during that time we could call in the people who were actually eyewitnesses.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: We've read their accounts now about what happened.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: It was very clear this was not a demonstration.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: This was an attack by terrorists.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: And this calls into question the president's whole policy in the Middle East.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: Look what's happening in Syria, in Egypt, now in Libya.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: Consider the distance between ourselves and -- and Israel, the president said that -- that he was going to put daylight between us and Israel.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: We have Iran four years closer to a nuclear bomb.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: The president's policies throughout the Middle East began with an apology tour and -- and -- and pursue a strategy of leading from behind, and this strategy is unraveling before our very eyes.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: Secretary Clinton has done an extraordinary job.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: But she works for me.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: I'm the president and I'm always responsible, and that's why nobody's more interested in finding out exactly what happened than I do.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: The day after the attack, governor, I stood in the Rose Garden and I told the American people in the world that we are going to find out exactly what happened.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: That this was an act of terror and I also said that we're going to hunt down those who committed this crime.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: And then a few days later, I was there greeting the caskets coming into Andrews Air Force Base and grieving with the families.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: And the suggestion that anybody in my team, whether the Secretary of State, our U.N.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: Ambassador, anybody on my team would play politics or mislead when we've lost four of our own, governor, is offensive.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: That's not what we do.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: That's not what I do as president, that's not what I do as Commander in Chief.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: I -- I think interesting the president just said something which -- which is that on the day after the attack he went into the Rose Garden and said that this was an act of terror.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: You said in the Rose Garden the day after the attack, it was an act of terror.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: It was not a spontaneous demonstration, is that what you're saying?
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: I want to make sure we get that for the record because it took the president 14 days before he called the attack in Benghazi an act of terror.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: This -- the administration -- the administration indicated this was a reaction to a video and was a spontaneous reaction.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: It took them a long time to say this was a terrorist act by a terrorist group.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: And to suggest -- am I incorrect in that regard, on Sunday, the -- your secretary --
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: -- this was a spontaneous --
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: I'm happy to do that, too.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: I just want to make sure that --
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: -- all of these wonderful folks are going to have a chance to get some of their questions answered.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: We're a nation that believes in the Second Amendment, and I believe in the Second Amendment.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: We've got a long tradition of hunting and sportsmen and people who want to make sure they can protect themselves.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: But there have been too many instances during the course of my presidency, where I've had to comfort families who have lost somebody.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: Most recently out in Aurora.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: You know, just a couple of weeks ago, actually, probably about a month, I saw a mother, who I had met at the bedside of her son, who had been shot in that theater.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: And her son had been shot through the head.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: And we spent some time, and we said a prayer and, remarkably, about two months later, this young man and his mom showed up, and he looked unbelievable, good as new.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: But there were a lot of families who didn't have that good fortune and whose sons or daughters or husbands didn't survive.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: So my belief is that, (A), we have to enforce the laws we've already got, make sure that we're keeping guns out of the hands of criminals, those who are mentally ill. We've done a much better job in terms of background checks, but we've got more to do when it comes to enforcement.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: But I also share your belief that weapons that were designed for soldiers in war theaters don't belong on our streets.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: And so what I'm trying to do is to get a broader conversation about how do we reduce the violence generally.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: Part of it is seeing if we can get an assault weapons ban reintroduced.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: But part of it is also looking at other sources of the violence.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: Because frankly, in my home town of Chicago, there's an awful lot of violence and they're not using AK-47s.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: They're using cheap hand guns.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: And so what can we do to intervene, to make sure that young people have opportunity; that our schools are working; that if there's violence on the streets, that working with faith groups and law enforcement, we can catch it before it gets out of control.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: And so what I want is a -- is a comprehensive strategy.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: Part of it is seeing if we can get automatic weapons that kill folks in amazing numbers out of the hands of criminals and the mentally ill.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: But part of it is also going deeper and seeing if we can get into these communities and making sure we catch violent impulses before they occur.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: Yeah, I'm not in favor of new pieces of legislation on -- on guns and taking guns away or making certain guns illegal.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: We, of course, don't want to have automatic weapons, and that's already illegal in this country to have automatic weapons.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: What I believe is we have to do, as the president mentioned towards the end of his remarks there, which is to make enormous efforts to enforce the gun laws that we have, and to change the culture of violence that we have.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: And you ask how -- how are we going to do that?
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: And there are a number of things.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: We were able to drive our schools to be number one in the nation in my state.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: And I believe if we do a better job in education, we'll -- we'll give people the -- the hope and opportunity they deserve and perhaps less violence from that.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: But let me mention another thing.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: We need moms and dads, helping to raise kids.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: Wherever possible the -- the benefit of having two parents in the home, and that's not always possible.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: A lot of great single moms, single dads.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: But gosh to tell our kids that before they have babies, they ought to think about getting married to someone, that's a great idea.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: Because if there's a two parent family, the prospect of living in poverty goes down dramatically.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: The opportunities that the child will -- will be able to achieve increase dramatically.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: So we can make changes in the way our culture works to help bring people away from violence and give them opportunity, and bring them in the American system.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: The -- the greatest failure we've had with regards to -- to gun violence in some respects is what -- what is known as Fast and Furious.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: Which was a program under this administration, and how it worked exactly I think we don't know precisely, where thousands of automatic, and AK-47 type weapons were -- were given to people that ultimately gave them to -- to drug lords.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: They used those weapons against -- against their own citizens and killed Americans with them.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: And this was a -- this was a program of the government.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: For what purpose it was put in place, I can't imagine.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: But it's one of the great tragedies related to violence in our society which has occurred during this administration.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: Which I think the American people would like to understand fully, it's been investigated to a degree, but -- but the administration has carried out executive privilege to prevent all of the information from coming out.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: I'd like to understand who it was that did this, what the idea was behind it, why it led to the violence, thousands of guns going to Mexican drug lords.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: Well, Candy, actually, in my state, the pro-gun folks and the anti-gun folks came together and put together a piece of legislation.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: And it's referred to as an assault weapon ban, but it had, at the signing of the bill, both the pro-gun and the anti-gun people came together, because it provided opportunities for both that both wanted.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: There were hunting opportunities, for instance, that haven't previously been available and so forth, so it was a mutually agreed- upon piece of legislation.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: That's what we need more of, Candy.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: What we have right now in Washington is a place that's gridlocked.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: -- we haven't had the leadership in Washington to work on a bipartisan basis.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: I was able to do that in my state and bring these two together.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: The -- first of all, I think Governor Romney was for an assault weapons ban before he was against it.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: And he said that the reason he changed his mind was, in part, because he was seeking the endorsement of the National Rifle Association.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: So that's on the record.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: But I think that one area we agree on is the important of parents and the importance of schools, because I do believe that if our young people have opportunity, then they are less likely to engage in these kinds of violent acts.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: We're not going to eliminate everybody who is mentally disturbed and we have got to make sure they don't get weapons.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: But we can make a difference in terms ensuring that every young person in America, regardless of where they come from, what they look like, have a chance to succeed.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: And, Candy, we haven't had a chance to talk about education much, but I think it is very important to understand that the reforms we've put in place, working with 46 governors around the country, are seeing schools that are some of the ones that are the toughest for kids starting to succeed.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: We're starting to see gains in math and science.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: When it comes to community colleges, we are setting up programs, including with Nassau Community College, to retrain workers, including young people who may have dropped out of school but now are getting another chance, training them for the jobs that exist right now.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: And in fact, employers are looking for skilled workers.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: And so we're matching them up.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: Giving them access to higher education.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: As I said, we have made sure that millions of young people are able to get an education that they weren't able to get before.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: Because -- because this is important.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: This is part of the choice in this election.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: When Governor Romney was asked whether teachers, hiring more teachers was important to growing our economy, Governor Romney said that doesn't grow our economy.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: When -- when he was asked would class size...
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: But this will make a difference in terms of whether or not we can move this economy forward for these young people...
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: ... and reduce our violence.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: Boy, great question and important question, because you're absolutely right.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: The place where we've seen manufacturing go has been China.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: China is now the largest manufacturer in the world.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: It used to be the United States of America.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: A lot of good people have lost jobs.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: A half a million manufacturing jobs have been lost in the last four years.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: That's total over the last four years.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: One of the reasons for that is that people think it's more attractive in some cases to go offshore than to stay here.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: We have made it less attractive for enterprises to stay here than to go offshore from time to time.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: What I will do as president is make sure it's more attractive to come to America again.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: This is the way we're going to create jobs in this country.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: It's not by trickle-down government, saying we're going to take more money from people and hire more government workers, raise more taxes, put in place more regulations.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: Trickle-down government has never worked here, has never worked anywhere.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: I want to make America the most attractive place in the world for entrepreneurs, for small business, for big business, to invest and grow in America.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: Now, we're going to have to make sure that as we trade with other nations that they play by the rules.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: One of the reasons -- or one of the ways they don't play by the rules is artificially holding down the value of their currency.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: Because if they put their currency down low, that means their prices on their goods are low.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: And that makes them advantageous in the marketplace.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: And manufacturers here in the U.S. making the same products can't compete.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: China has been a currency manipulator for years and years and years.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: And the president has a regular opportunity to label them as a currency manipulator, but refuses to do so.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: On day one, I will label China a currency manipulator, which will allow me as president to be able to put in place, if necessary, tariffs where I believe that they are taking unfair advantage of our manufacturers.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: So we're going to make sure that people we trade with around the world play by the rules.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: But let me -- let me not just stop there.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: Don't forget, what's key to bringing back jobs here is not just finding someone else to punish, and I'm going to be strict with people who we trade with to make sure they -- they follow the law and play by the rules, but it's also to make America the most attractive place in the world for businesses of all kinds.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: That's why I want to down the tax rates on small employers, big employers, so they want to be here.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: Canada's tax rate on companies is now 15 percent.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: So if you're starting a business, where would you rather start it?
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: We have to be competitive if we're going to create more jobs here.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: The rate of regulations quadrupled under this president.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: I talk to small businesses across the country.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: They say, "We feel like we're under attack from our own government."
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: I want to make sure that regulators see their job as encouraging small business, not crushing it.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: And there's no question but that Obamacare has been an extraordinary deterrent to enterprises of all kinds hiring people.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: My priority is making sure that we get more people hired.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: If we have more people hired, if we get back manufacturing jobs, if we get back all kinds of jobs into this country, then you're going to see rising incomes again.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: The reason incomes are down is because unemployment is so high.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: I know what it takes to get this to happen, and my plan will do that, and one part of it is to make sure that we keep China playing by the rules.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: But there's a difference in terms of how we would do it.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: I want to close loopholes that allow companies to deduct expenses when they move to China; that allow them to profit offshore and not have to get taxed, so they have tax advantages offshore.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: All those changes in our tax code would make a difference.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: Now, Governor Romney actually wants to expand those tax breaks.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: One of his big ideas when it comes to corporate tax reform would be to say, if you invest overseas, you make profits overseas, you don't have to pay U.S. taxes.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: But, of course, if you're a small business or a mom-and-pop business or a big business starting up here, you've got to pay even the reduced rate that Governor Romney's talking about.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: And it's estimated that that will create 800,000 new jobs.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: The problem is they'll be in china.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: That's not the way we're going to create jobs here.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: That's creating tens of thousands of jobs all across the country.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: That's why we've kept on pushing trade deals, but trade deals that make sure that American workers and American businesses are getting a good deal.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: Now, Governor Romney talked about China, as I already indicated.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: In the private sector, Governor Romney's company invested in what were called pioneers of outsourcing.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: That's what reporters called it.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: And as far as currency manipulation, the currency has actually gone up 11 percent since I've been president because we have pushed them hard.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: And we've put unprecedented trade pressure on China.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: That's why exports have significantly increased under my presidency.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: That's going to help to create jobs here.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: The answer is very straightforward.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: China's been cheating over the years.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: One by holding down the value of their currency.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: Number two, by stealing our intellectual property; our designs, our patents, our technology.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: There's even an Apple store in China that's a counterfeit Apple store, selling counterfeit goods.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: They hack into our computers.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: Number two, we have to make America the most attractive place for entrepreneurs, for people who want to expand their business.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: That's what brings jobs in.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: The president's characterization of my tax plan...
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: Candy, there are some jobs that are not going to come back.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: Because they are low wage, low skill jobs.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: I want high wage, high skill jobs.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: That's why we have to emphasize manufacturing.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: That's why we have to invest in advanced manufacturing.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: That's why we've got to make sure that we've got the best science and research in the world.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: And when we talk about deficits, if we're adding to our deficit for tax cuts for folks who don't need them, and we're cutting investments in research and science that will create the next Apple, create the next new innovation that will sell products around the world, we will lose that race.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: If we're not training engineers to make sure that they are equipped here in this country.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: Then companies won't come here.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: Those investments are what's going to help to make sure that we continue to lead this world economy, not just next year, but 10 years from now, 50 years from now, 100 years from now.
Speaker: Barack Obama

Text: Government does not create jobs.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: Government does not create jobs.
Speaker: Mitt Romney

Text: In the nature of a campaign, it seems that some campaigns are focused on attacking a person rather than prescribing their own future and the things they'd like to do.
Speaker: Mitt Romney
